title: Constitution is supreme, all three wings of democracy work under it: CJI Gavai
content: “While many say and believe that Parliament is supreme, according to me, it is the Constitution of India that is supreme”

title: Should the method of counting caste change? | Explained
content: What are the two phases of the Census? Why has caste enumeration been included in the upcoming Census, according to the Union government? What are the reforms the Census should undertake in order to facilitate data that will be helpful for bringing the marginalised to the mainstream?

title: Ashok Gehlot’s remarks on ‘conspiracy’ to topple CM Bhajan Lal Sharma create flutter in Rajasthan
content: The ruling Bharatiya Janata Party leaders reacted sharply and advised Mr. Gehlot to pay attention to the leadership crisis in his own party.

title: NDDB takes charge of three dairy plants in U.P., CM Yogi reiterates commitment on strengthening rural economy
content: U.P. government in its statement added With NDDB taking charge of these facilities, new standards of efficiency, transparency, and professionalism will be established

title: Four of a family, including new born died after car fell in a canal in Haldwani
content: The family was on its way back home after getting the new born and the mother discharged from the hospital, police said

title: After 40 years of chase, CBI arrests proclaimed offender in ₹5.69 lakh bank fraud case
content: The CBI which had registered the case in 1978 spent seven years in investigation and trial, resulting in the conviction of Satish Kumar Anand

title: Mosque loudspeaker row: Ajit Pawar directs police not to take any wrongful action
content: Maharashtra Deputy CM’s comment came after the delegation of Muslim leaders complained of campaigns against loudspeakers by Kirit Somaiya in several areas of Mumbai, as well as police action on removing the loudspeakers

title: Bombay High Court quashes dowry harassment case, flags misuse of Section 498-A
content: The Aurangabad Bench of the Bombay High Court has quashed criminal proceedings against six members of a family accused of dowry harassment, calling it a “classic example” of misuse of Section 498-A of the IPC

title: Government clears ₹417-crore electronics manufacturing cluster in Uttar Pradesh under EMC scheme
content: The cluster will be in Gautam Buddha Nagar, which comprises Noida and Greater Noida and the Funds under Electronics Manufacturing Cluster 2.0 are to be disbursed up to April 2028

title: West Bengal CM Mamata announces new TCS office in New Town, spread over 20 acres
content: Earlier, the Chief Minister had also shared that semiconductor manufacturer GlobalFoundries will set up a fabless centre for design and testing at their Kolkata Power Centre

title: Chemotherapy drugs made by Indian firms fail quality tests, shows study
content: A landmark study published on June 26 has reported that about a fifth of cancer drugs tested failed quality tests; 16 of the 17 implicated manufacturers are India-based

title: Bombay High Court questions legal basis of stipend for junior lawyers
content: The High Court was hearing a petition filed by 12 junior advocates seeking a ₹5,000 monthly stipend during the first three years of legal practice

title: Himachal Pradesh cloudbursts, flash floods | 2 dead, 20 feared swept away in Kangra, heavy rain continues
content: Tragic cloudbursts and flash floods in Himachal Pradesh cause casualties and destruction, with rescue operations underway

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) defends Emergency, calls it ‘constitutionally valid’
content: Sena (UBT) MP Sanjay Raut statement comes after Prime Minister Narendra Modi called the Emergency Samvidhan Hatya Diwas

title: Row erupts over school ‘kitchen divided by religion’ in West Bengal
content: Two kitchens made to cook together under police supervision after the issue caused a stir across the district and administration got involved

title: Demolition of Army towers: High Court orders hike in monthly rent
content: The directive follows review petitions by residents; court takes into account their need to stay in alternative housing for around 4 years

title: Flood warning issued as KRS dam nears full capacity
content: Alert sounded for areas downstream of the Kabini reservoir as rain continues to batter the catchment regions

title: MSME Growth Conclave 2025 | MSMEs need agile, secure ecosystem: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge
content: The Conclave highlights opportunities in defence, space, and aviation sectors for Indian entrepreneurs

title: Women Safety Wing teams up with Tata Advanced Systems to boost community policing
content: Collaboration seeks to strengthen vital safety units such as She Teams, Bharosa Centres, and Anti-Human Trafficking Units through tech interventions, capacity building and operational innovation

title: "He Looks Terrible": Trump On New York's Indian-Origin Mayor Candidate
content: US Donald Trump has weighed in on the victory of Indian-origin leftist socialist Zohran Mamdani in New York City's Democratic mayoral primary election, calling him a "100 per cent communist lunatic".

title: Harvard Scientist Accused Of Smuggling Frog Embryos Indicted On New Charges
content: A Russian-born scientist at Harvard University accused of smuggling frog embryos into the United States was indicted on Wednesday on additional charges nearly two weeks after her lawyers secured her release from US custody.

title: 12 Killed In Mass Shooting At Religious Celebration In Mexico
content: Twelve people were killed overnight in the Mexican state of Guanajuato when gunmen opened fire on a celebration in the city of Irapuato, authorities said Wednesday.

title: Rajnath Singh Arrives For SCO Defence Ministers' Meet In Qingdao
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh arrived at the venue for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Defence Ministers' meeting at Qingdao, China, on Thursday.

title: Row Over "Silver Plates" At Mumbai Conclave And A "Bankruptcy" Jibe
content: Congress Legislature Party leader in Maharashtra Vijay Wadettiwar claimed on Wednesday estimate committee members were served meal in silver plates at a conclave.

title: NATO Agrees To Hike Defence Spending By 5%: What It Really Mean?
content: NATO leaders are set to sign off Wednesday at their Hague summit on a defence spending pledge to satisfy US President Donald Trump's demand for a headline figure of five per cent of GDP.

title: CIA Chief Says Iran Nuke Sites Severely Damaged After Minimal Impact Report
content: CIA Director John Ratcliffe claimed on Wednesday that new intelligence indicates Iran's nuclear infrastructure suffered severe and long-term damage following recent US airstrikes, contradicting reports suggesting the impact had been limited.

title: "Witch Hunt": Trump Urges End To Netanyahu's Corruption Trial
content: US President Donald Trump weighed in on ally Benjamin Netanyahu's long-running corruption trial Wednesday, urging for Israel's "Great War Time Prime Minister" to be exonerated after the conflict with Iran.

title: "Can't Kill My Father...": Haryana Man Dies By Suicide, Blames Wife, Her Boyfriend
content: A man in his early 30s has committed suicide here after posting a video on social media accusing his wife and boyfriend of harassment, police said on Wednesday.

title: SEBI Fines Rs 25 Lakh Penalty on BSE for flouting regulatory norms
content: Capital markets regulator Sebi on Wednesday slapped a Rs 25 lakh penalty on BSE for failing to provide equal access to corporate disclosures to all stakeholders and take action against brokers with frequent modifications during trades.

title: Case Against BJP Leader For Harassing Woman Police officer In Pune
content: The Pune City Police have registered a case against Pramod Kondhre, general secretary of the BJP's city unit, for allegedly sexually harassing a senior woman police officer on Monday, said a senior Pune City Police official on Wednesday.

title: "They Need Money": Trump Signals US May Ease Iran Oil Sanction
content: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that the U.S. has not given up its maximum pressure on Iran - including restrictions on sales of Iranian oil - but signaled a potential easing in enforcement to help the country rebuild.

title: Trump Repeats Claim Of US "Obliterated" Iran Nuclear Sites
content: US President Donald Trump has once again asserted his claims on Washington "obliterating" Iranian nuclear sites during its targeted strikes on June 22, riding on Israel's assessment made by the Israel Atomic Energy Commission (IAEC) on those sites.

title: BJP Protests At Tripura Congress MLA Residence Over "Urinate" Remarks
content: A group of BJP activists stormed the premises of the MLA hostel in Radhanagar area in Agartala on Wednesday over the Congress MLA Sudip Roy Barman's controversial remarks against Tribal community.

title: "Very Close": Trump Hints At Gaza Ceasefire After Israel-Iran Truce
content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday that progress was being made to end the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza, as a new ceasefire push began more than 20 months since the start of the conflict.

title: Iran Partially Reopens Airspace After Ceasefire With Israel
content: Iran on Wednesday reopened the airspace over the country's east, state media reported, following a ceasefire with Israel that ended 12 days of fighting.

title: Chinese President Xi Jinping To Skip BRICS Summit In Brazil: Report
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping plans to skip the BRICS Summit in Brazil next month, which, if confirmed, will be his first-ever absence from the meeting of the grouping of emerging economies since taking office 12 years ago, according to media reports.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla's Axiom 4 Mission Creates History For 3 Countries
content: The Axiom 4 launch, a commercial human spaceflight mission involving Axiom Space, NASA, and SpaceX, has scripted history in more ways than one.

title: Israel Thanks US' CIA For Help In "Joint" Operation Against Iran War
content: The head of Israel's Mossad intelligence service thanked the US Central Intelligence Agency on Wednesday for its help in "joint" operations during the recent 12-day war with Iran.

title: World Bank Approves $426 Million For Bengaluru Water Security Project
content: The World Bank has sanctioned USD 426 million for a new initiative to enhance water security for over four million residents in Bengaluru, officials said.

title: ‘NCC syllabus revamped with focus on tech and innovation’
content: NCC chief speaks of rising gender parity, tech-led revamps and plans of expanding the corps in underserved areas while strengthening its role as a career springboard

title: In Sirkazhi’s villages, palm leaves are helping women weave peace into their lives
content: The initiative is led by Valanadu Sustainable Agriculture Producer Company, a women-run farmer producer company supported by the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development.

title: Industry bodies seek rollback of Haryana power tariff hike
content: They claim that the charges, significantly higher compared to neighbouring States, could force manufacturing units to eventually migrate

title: Maharashtra emblem replaced with Sengol in government advertisements on Emergency: Congress
content: The Congress came down heavily on the State Government over emblem replacement and reports of meal being served on silver plates to members of the Estimates Committees of Parliament

title: Joint Assam-Meghalaya hydropower project opposed
content: Members of 19 organisations organise a protest rally before submitting memoranda to the Chief Ministers of the two States via the Chhaygaon Circle Officer

title: Work tirelessly to resolve people’s issues, Lokesh tells TDP cadre
content: Lauding the resilience of the party workers who stood strong despite facing false cases during the previous YSRCP regime, he exhorts them to continue serving with the same spirit

title: CSEP study highlights the need for Karnataka to widen State-level initiatives in primary healthcare and elementary education
content: The researchers say Karnataka exhibits stark intra-State disparities, and the uptake of public health and education facilities compared to private ones is poor

title: Congress hails launch of Axiom-4 mission with Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla aboard
content: “’Touch the Sky with Glory’. We welcome the successful launch of the space mission carrying astronauts from India, Hungary, Poland, and the US,” Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said in a post on X

title: Rural Development & Panchayat Raj launches 100-day audit resolution campaign
content: Drive launched to address objections and recovery notices flagged in the audit reports of gram panchayats

title: Devanahalli farmers serve 24-hour ultimatum to govt. to shelve land acquisition
content: They write to Chief Minister saying that they would intensify their protest from Thursday and get arrested if the acquisition was not stopped

title: Will meet Election Commission after getting rolls in digital format: Congress
content: The Opposition party was responding to the invitation for an interaction sent by the poll body to Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi following his allegations of ‘industrial scale’ rigging in the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly polls

title: Daughters of residential school staff now eligible for on-campus education
content: The policy decision will reduce the burden on teachers and staff, enabling them to keep their families together while ensuring their daughters receive quality education in a supportive environment

title: New ECINET platform used during bypolls helped with faster update of voter turnout trends: ECI
content: Another major achievement during the bypolls was uploading of voter turnout trends directly by the presiding officers on ECINET as against the earlier manual process

title: Andhra Pradesh Handlooms Weavers Cooperative Society to implement 2022 PRC recommendations for its employees
content: The APCO board approves a proposal allowing the employees to monetise 15 days of earned leave annually

title: Media bodies urge Centre to keep journalistic work outside the ambit of Digital Personal Data Protection Act
content: Twenty-two press bodies located in various States expressed deep concern at the Ministry bringing journalistic work under its ambit, even though it was kept out at the drafting stage of the Bill

title: NHRC issues notice to Odisha government over social boycott of tribal woman
content: Commission seeks report within two weeks after family forced to undergo ‘purification’ ritual following inter-caste marriage in Rayagada district

title: Lucknow cheers city boy Shubhanshu Shukla; proud moment for all, say parents
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla’s school hosts an event to watch the lift off live; people across Lucknow also celebrate the local boy’s space journey, with people dancing and distributing sweets

title: Karnataka govt. seeks revised proposal for Goa-Tamnar power project
content: This sudden change in stance by the State government on an environmental issue with serious consequences for the sensitive Western Ghats ecosystem has riled up activists

title: Pilgrims visit Mount Kailash, Mansarovar after six-year wait
content: First people-to-people mechanism restored between India and China after COVID and LAC stand-off disrupted the yatra; “the grand organisation for this cross-Himalayan cultural exchange is an important consensus between the leaders of India and China,” says Wen Tao, Deputy Commissioner of Ali Prefecture

title: BMS not to oppose or support general strike on July 9
content: RSS chief to inaugurate concluding ceremony in Delhi; union to focus on gig and platform workers, demands social security for unorganised sector

title: Siddaramaiah meets party top brass, awaits Rahul’s nod for Cabinet reshuffle, filling four seats in Council
content: The party said the Chief Minister has made efforts to convince the high command of the necessity of the Cabinet reshuffle to induct new faces

title: NHRC seeks report from U.P. over custodial deaths in Varanasi jail
content: Commission issues notices to DGP (Prisons) and Varanasi Police Commissioner after three inmates die within two days; asks for post-mortem and magisterial inquiry reports

title: ‘Bharat Mata’ row erupts at Kerala University, Governor’s presence fuels student clashes
content: The event, organised by the Sree Padmanabha Seva Samiti at the university’s Senate Hall in Palayam to mark the 50th anniversary of the Emergency, wades into controversy over a Bharat Mata portrait, which has emerged the bone of contention between the State government and Raj Bhavan for nearly a month

title: U.K. plans to repair grounded F-35B in Kerala itself
content: Engineers from HMS Prince of Wales aircraft carrier had assessed the aircraft, and it had been decided that the support of a U.K.-based engineering team is needed

title: Chhattisgarh seeks Centre’s help after Forest Department stalls community forest resource management plans
content: State Forest Department stops NGOs from starting work on CFR management plans till a model plan is approved; Tribal Ministry guidelines say gram sabhas have authority to approve plans, then consult Forest Departmenmt

title: Bihar leaders mark Emergency anniversary with call to uphold democratic values
content: CM Nitish Kumar, Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary, and BJP’s Anurag Thakur recall legacy of J.P. movement, allege Congress undermined Constitution during Emergency

title: Mavs take Flagg at No. 1: 'A dream come true'
content: The Mavericks selected Duke forward Cooper Flagg with the first pick of the 2025 NBA draft Wednesday night.

title: Suns acquire Hornets' Williams, draft Maluach
content: The Suns acquired Hornets center Mark Williams for the No. 29 pick and a 2029 first-round pick and then selected center Khaman Maluach with the No. 10 pick.

title: Bailey surprised by Jazz: 'No idea' they'd pick me
content: Rutgers forward Ace Bailey said he had "no idea" the Jazz had interest in taking him with the No. 5 pick, and a source told ESPN that Utah was not among his preferred destinations.

title: Harper goes 2nd, joins Spurs' 'great young core'
content: The Spurs are hoping to have a third straight Rookie of the Year in Rutgers' Dylan Harper, whom they took with the second pick of the NBA draft.

title: 76ers take Edgecombe; Pels trade up for Queen
content: The Philadelphia 76ers selected 19-year-old guard VJ Edgecombe out of Baylor with the No. 3 pick in the NBA draft.

title: Sources: 84-game NHL season part of CBA talks
content: An increase over the NHL's current 82-game schedule has been discussed internally by the league, and the topic is part of negotiations with the players' union for the new CBA, sources told ESPN.

title: 76ers expect Embiid to return for training camp
content: 76ers center Joel Embiid is on track to return from knee surgery when training camp opens in September, team president Daryl Morey said.

title: Arenas: 'Fighting time' to escape burning truck
content: USC basketball recruit Alijah Arenas said he was trapped in his burning Tesla Cybertruck for nearly 10 minutes before he was able to escpae.

title: 🎵 Taylor Swift surprises Tight End Univ. guests
content: Taylor Swift performs "Shake It Off" and walks the red carpet with Travis Kelce at Tight End University.

title: Dirk, Dallas pro teams react to Mavericks drafting Cooper Flagg at No. 1
content: Congratulations poured in after the Dallas Mavericks made Cooper Flagg the top pick of the 2025 NBA draft.

title: Power Rankings: Mercury overtake Liberty with five-game winning streak
content: Phoenix has bucked speculation over its new-look roster with 11 wins, including over the defending champions.

title: NHL draft buzz: Peterka on the move? Sharks not set at No. 2?
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: 'Championships, fan experience, community': After 20 years as Vikings owners, Wilfs have one last goal
content: The Wilf family built a revered stadium and gets rave reviews from players, but the Vikings have yet to win a Super Bowl.

title: 10 undervalued pass-catchers with intriguing upside or safer floors
content: Matt Bowen lists his favorites with week-winning potential and others who are dependable, despite lower ADPs.

title: 30-game winner Paul Skenes?! A new formula to bring pitcher wins back to life
content: MLB's best pitcher has a 1.85 ERA but just a 4-6 record. In the age of analytics, he's not alone. Here's how to fix it.

title: From Man City to Flamengo, why every last-16 team will, won't win Club World Cup
content: We're heading into the knockout rounds of the 2025 Club World Cup as the field of 32 splits in half this week. With updated odds and projections, here's why every remaining team will or won't win this thing.

title: Messi highest-paid in MLS as Miami sets record
content: Inter Miami forward Lionel Messi is Major League Soccer's highest-paid player for the second year running, with a total guaranteed compensation of $20.45 million, according to data released by the MLS Players Association.

title: Sources: Man United close in on Mbeumo deal
content: Manchester United are closing in on a deal for Bryan Mbeumo after a breakthrough in talks with Brentford, sources have told ESPN.

title: Luka Modric agrees to join AC Milan after CWC
content: Luka Modric has verbally agreed to sign for AC Milan, where he will sign a one-year contract, with an option to extend for another year.

title: Sources: Arsenal in talks for Brentford's Nørgaard
content: Arsenal have entered talks with Brentford over the signing of Christian Nørgaard, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ronaldo's Al Nassr coachless after Pioli exit
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's Saudi Arabian club Al Nassr is without a coach after Stefano Pioli left Wednesday, with the Italian expected to return home to Fiorentina.

title: Sources: Atlético reach deal for USMNT's Cardoso
content: Atlético Madrid have reached a verbal agreement with Betis to sign USMNT midfielder Johnny Cardoso, sources have told ESPN.

title: Court upholds Rubiales' sexual assault conviction
content: Spain's High Court on Wednesday upheld a verdict that found former soccer federation president Luis Rubiales guilty of sexual assault for an unsolicited kiss on the lips of national team player Jenni Hermoso at the 2023 World Cup in Sydney.

title: Mbappé out of Madrid's final CWC group game
content: Kylian Mbappé will miss Real Madrid's decisive Group H game at the Club World Cup against RB Salzburg as he continues his recovery from acute gastroenteritis

title: 'Everything's on the table' for Connor McDavid's NHL future
content: The NHL's best player has one year left on his contract. Will he re-sign, or will he test free agency in 2026?

title: Who makes the Hall of Fame in 2026? Ranking the top candidates
content: Does Patrice Bergeron make it in his first year eligible? What about Keith Tkachuk? Predicting the next class.

title: Inside Bryce Steele's journey back to football after battling cancer
content: After battling cancer in 2023, Boston College linebacker Bryce Steele is set to be a starter this fall.

title: How women's college stars are powering USA Basketball's AmeriCup team
content: LSU's Flau'jae Johnson and TCU's Olivia Miles are among 12 college standouts competing for the U.S. AmeriCup team.

title: Bilas: Eight prospects who stand out in this year's NBA draft class
content: From the no-brainer to the wild cards to those in between, here are eight prospects who caught Jay Bilas' eye.

title: Our one-stop shop for the draft: Mocks, order, big questions and more
content: From teams to watch to our latest mock draft, we have everything you need to know about the 2025 draft.

title: What impact will Cooper Flagg have as a rookie?
content: Andre Snellings looks at what fantasy managers can expect from Cooper Flagg as a rookie this season, and where he should be drafted in leagues.

title: Bradley's take: Will Jake Paul's hook land better than Julio César Chávez Jr.'s?
content: The question now is not if Paul can beat a real fighter, but if Chavez, a former champion, can go toe-to-toe with Paul.

title: Pound for pound: With Jon Jones walking away, where does the top 10 stand?
content: The consensus GOAT has retired, leaving the sport's remaining greats to line up differently in ESPN's rankings.

title: Five underappreciated starting pitchers you need to grab now
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft looks at the surprising lack of love for some of the starting pitchers with very strong underlying metrics.

title: What to know ahead of the Austrian Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 heads into round 11 in Spielberg as McLaren's Oscar Piastri remains championship leader - will the Austrian Grand Prix provide any upsets?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Juventus linked with move for Jackson
content: Juventus are reportedly looking to sign Chelsea's Nicolas Jackson in the summer transfer window. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Sheltering terrorists': Rajnath slams Pak at SCO Summit; Khawaja Asif present
content: At the SCO Defence Ministers' meeting in  China's Qingdao, Rajnath Singh criticized Pakistan for supporting cross-border terrorism, emphasizing that such double standards should not be tolerated. He highlighted the challenges of radicalization, extremism, and terrorism in the region, advocating for united action against these threats.

title: Navy staffer held for spying for Pakistan; leaked info during Op Sindoor
content: Vishal Yadav, a clerk at the Naval office in New Delhi, has been arrested for allegedly leaking classified defence information to a Pakistani handler. He shared sensitive details, including those related to Op Sindoor, in exchange for money to fund his online gaming addiction. Yadav was apprehended in Jaipur under the Official Secrets Act.

title: Gunmen open fire at religious celebration in Mexico; 12 killed
content: A religious celebration in Irapuato, Mexico, turned deadly when gunmen opened fire, resulting in 12 fatalities and at least 20 injuries. The attack occurred during festivities for the Nativity of St. John the Baptist, with revellers dancing in the street when the shooting began. Guanajuato state, plagued by cartel violence, has seen a surge in homicides this year.

title: Iran nuke sites 'severely damaged': US spy chief, CIA back Trump's claim
content: Top US intelligence officials strongly refuted media reports downplaying the impact of recent airstrikes on Iran's nuclear sites. Director od national inteligence Tulsi Gabbard asserted the 'complete destruction' of facilities at Natanz, Fordow, and Isfahan, estimating years for reconstruction. CIA director John Ratcliffe confirmed 'credible intelligence' indicating serious setbacks to Iran's nuclear program.

title: '100% communist lunatic': Trump slams Zohran Mamdani after NYC primary win
content: Donald Trump criticized Zohran Mamdani, labeling him a "100% Communist Lunatic" after his apparent mayoral primary win against Andrew Cuomo. Trump's post on Truth Social also targeted Chuck Schumer with false claims. Republicans are attempting to portray Mamdani as representative of the Democratic party, while some conservatives are attacking his faith.

title: America’s China threat: Huawei’s new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions; What experts are saying
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: IND vs ENG: Why is Jaiswal dropping catches? Ex-India cricketer explains
content: Mohammed Kaif suggests that Yashasvi Jaiswal's dropped catches in the recent Test against England may be due to the straps he wears on his hands. Kaif explains that these straps restrict finger movement, preventing a secure grip on the ball.

title: Smoke and sparks midair: American flight makes emergency landing - Watch video
content: An American Airlines flight had to return to Las Vegas. This happened after smoke and sparks came from an engine. The flight, numbered 1665, was going to Charlotte. The plane landed safely with 153 passengers and six crew. No one was hurt. The aircraft is now under maintenance. The FAA is investigating the incident.

title: Cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh leave 2 dead, up to 20 missing
content: Torrential rain in Himachal Pradesh triggered cloudbursts and flash floods, resulting in at least two confirmed deaths near Dharamshala, with fears of 15-20 workers missing from a hydroelectric project site. Kullu district was severely affected, witnessing damaged homes and missing persons, while infrastructure and roads suffered extensive damage across multiple regions due to the deluge.

title: Walmart CEO Doug McMillon says, Walmart will announce the next goal for India once ...
content: Doug McMillon, Walmart's CEO, advocates for fair and consistent policies across all operating countries, highlighting the company's adeptness at navigating tariff challenges through diverse sourcing strategies. Walmart prioritizes local sourcing and job creation, aiming to source $10 billion annually from India by 2027. McMillon emphasizes the importance of transparent regulations and Walmart's commitment to maintaining low prices for customers globally.

title: US-Iran conflict: Trump may ease oil sanctions on Tehran; says 'they're going to need money'
content: US President Donald Trump hinted at potentially easing Iran oil sanctions to aid the nation's reconstruction, even while maintaining a "maximum pressure" strategy. Trump suggested China could resume Iranian oil purchases following a ceasefire agreement between Israel and Iran. However, the White House clarified that existing US sanctions remain in effect.

title: 'Witch-hunt': Trump demands end to Netanyahu's corruption trial
content: Donald Trump has called for the cancellation of Benjamin Netanyahu's corruption trial, praising the former Israeli Prime Minister's wartime leadership against Iran. Trump, in a Truth Social post, condemned Israel's "witch-hunt" against Netanyahu, citing their collaboration in eliminating a significant nuclear threat. Netanyahu faces charges of accepting luxury goods and attempting to manipulate media coverage, allegations he denies.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha recommends Coromandel, Cummins India, and BHEL as top buys for today. Nifty is expected to reach 25500, supported by crude price drops, while Bank Nifty aims for fresh highs from its 56200 breakout.

title: Amazon employees to CEO: 'Nothing more motivating on a Tuesday than...'
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy warned corporate employees about upcoming workforce reductions due to AI-driven "efficiency gains." This announcement sparked internal backlash, with employees expressing concerns about job displacement and over-reliance on AI. Jassy envisions a future dominated by AI agents, but workers question the impact on leadership and the reliability of these systems.

title: India's time in space: Axiom-4 lifts off; how Dragon will put Shubhanshu Shukla inside ISS
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla made history as the second Indian to cross the Karman line, following Rakesh Sharma. Aboard the Axiom-4 mission's 'Dragon' capsule named 'Grace', Shukla radioed a message of pride to India, marking the beginning of India's human space flight program.

title: 'Rs 540cr drug money laundering': Akali Dal leader Majithia arrested after raid at Amritsar house
content: Bikram Singh Majithia, a senior SAD leader and former minister, was arrested by the Vigilance Bureau in Amritsar on Wednesday following the registration of a disproportionate assets case against him. The arrest followed investigations into a drug case, with allegations of laundering over Rs 540 crore of drug money.

title: NBA trade rumors: Warriors eye Mark Williams; $18m rookie may join Curry-Butler
content: Golden State Warriors are seeking a dominant center. The team considers trading for Charlotte's Mark Williams. Williams has potential but is injury-prone. A trade would involve Moses Moody and a draft pick. Warriors need to decide if Williams is worth the risk. Alternative options include trading for Clint Capela or Jarrett Allen.

title: £100M F-35 fighter jet stranded in Kerala: Thiruvananthapuram Airport to charge parking fee
content: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport will levy parking fees on a grounded British Royal Navy F-35 fighter jet, stranded for nearly 10 days due to a hydraulic issue. While the fee calculation is pending, engineers from the UK and US are expected to arrive for repairs. The incident marks the first time this advanced fighter jet has been stranded abroad.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ Box Office collection day 6: Aamir Khan’s film crosses Rs 80cr mark
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par', directed by RS Prasanna, has earned over ₹80 crore in India during its first week. The sports dramedy, considered a spiritual sequel to 'Taare Zameen Par', opened strongly with ₹10.7 crore on Friday, peaking at ₹27.25 crore on Sunday. The film also had a special screening at Rashtrapati Bhavan, attended by President Droupadi Murmu.

title: US sate secy Marco Rubio says Iran 'much further away from nukes' after strikes
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio stated that Iran's nuclear weapons program is significantly set back following recent US airstrikes, contradicting reports suggesting minimal impact. While President Trump hinted at regime change, Rubio clarified the US aims to prevent Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons, viewing regime change as a potential consequence of Iran's current trajectory.

title: Trump claims Israeli agents inspected Iran site, saw 'total obliteration'
content: Following US airstrikes on Iran's Fordo nuclear site, President Trump claimed Israel might have inspected the damage, asserting "total obliteration." Despite a leaked report suggesting minimal setbacks to Iran's nuclear program, Trump insisted the strikes caused decades of delay. He warned of further action if uranium enrichment resumes, drawing a controversial comparison to the bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

title: Hockey Canada sexual assault trial: Scandal threatening Canadian sports forever
content: A high-profile sexual assault trial involving five former Team Canada junior hockey players has gripped the nation. Graphic testimony and legal twists marked the intense weeks. The complainant's account of the 2018 incident was met with defense challenges. Carter Hart testified, claiming consensual acts. Justice Maria Carroccia will now rule alone after jury dismissal.

title: Indian in space: A 41-year wait that won’t repeat
content: After a 41-year gap, India celebrates Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla as its second astronaut, following Rakesh Sharma's 1984 mission. Shukla's flight signifies India's growing ambition in space exploration, closely tied to the Gaganyaan program. ISRO is developing indigenous technologies for crew safety and astronaut training, aiming for self-reliance in future missions.

title: Fire Services chief calls for mandatory, annual fire safety audits of pharma units
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the latest news is from the world of cinema and streaming . science writers take the jargon out of science and puts the fun in .

title: Taylor Swift crashes Kane Brown’s big moment with bold surprise at TEU concert
content: Kane Brown headlined the Tight End University concert in Nashville, thinking he was the main attraction. However, the crowd erupted when Taylor Swift unexpectedly joined him on stage, creating a viral moment. The surprise appearance, confirmed by the NFL and TEU, delighted fans and players alike, overshadowing Brown's performance and becoming the event's highlight.

title: Zohran Mamdani: Indian-American shakes up Democratic Party - future or fluke?
content: Zohran Mamdani, a democratic socialist, has taken a surprising lead in New York City's mayoral primary, prompting Andrew Cuomo to concede. This race highlights the Democratic Party's internal divisions and signals the rise of its progressive wing. Mamdani's focus on affordability and grassroots campaigning resonated with young voters, but his socialist views could face challenges in the general election.

title: ‘Just praise him a little’: Trump repeats mediation claim; Congress taunts PM Modi again
content: The Congress party has strongly criticized Prime Minister Modi following Donald Trump's renewed claim of halting a war between India and Pakistan using trade leverage. Congress leader Pawan Khera accused Modi of potentially compromising India's interests for praise. Trump asserted he intervened through phone calls, linking trade deals to de-escalation.

title: 'Daddy used strong words': Trump likens Iran-Israel clash to schoolyard fight
content: During a NATO summit, Mark Rutte jokingly called Donald Trump "daddy" after Trump likened the Iran-Israel conflict to a schoolyard fight. This exchange followed a US airstrike, Operation Midnight Hammer, which targeted Iranian nuclear facilities. The operation involved numerous aircraft and precision-guided weapons, including bunker-buster bombs, aimed at crippling Iran's uranium enrichment program.

title: Mitch Marner in Vegas, couple house-hunting sparks NHL trade buzz
content: As NHL free agency nears, speculation about Mitch Marner’s future intensifies. A new report claims Marner and his wife, Stephanie Marner were seen looking at homes in Las Vegas, adding fuel to the rumors. With cap-space moves and trade whispers surrounding the Golden Knights, the possibility of a Vegas relocation is gaining momentum.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir refuses to laud Pant's twin tons after loss – 'There were ...'
content: Following India's shocking Test defeat against England, head coach Gautam Gambhir downplayed individual achievements, despite centuries from Rishabh Pant and others. He emphasised the team's failure to defend a massive score, highlighting England's record chase led by Ben Duckett. Fast bowler Harshit Rana has been released from the squad as injury concerns eased.

title: 'I made some wrong friends, lost focus on cricket': Prithvi Shaw
content: Prithvi Shaw, once hailed as a future star, candidly admits to making poor choices and losing focus on cricket, leading to a decline in his career. After being dropped due to fitness issues and going unsold in the IPL, Shaw seeks a fresh start by leaving the Mumbai Cricket Association to play for Maharashtra.

title: China bridge collapse: Truck hangs mid-air with driver inside - watch
content: A cargo truck in China's Guizhou province precariously dangled from a collapsed highway bridge after a landslide triggered by torrential rains. The incident, captured on video and shared by Reuters, shows the truck's cabin hanging mid-air. Driver You Guochun recounted the terrifying moment, stating the bridge vanished before him. Emergency services swiftly rescued the driver, with no injuries reported.

title: IND vs ENG: India fast bowler released from squad ahead of 2nd Test in Birmingham
content: India's Harshit Rana has been released from the Test squad before the second match against England. This decision follows after India's loss at Headingley, despite their impressive 835 runs and five centuries. England's remarkable chase of 371, led by Ben Duckett's 149, secured a five-wicket victory. India aims to level the series in the upcoming Edgbaston Test on July 2.

title: Point of no return? Kharge takes 'Modi first' swipe; Tharoor responds with cryptic post
content: The ongoing tension between Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor escalated when Kharge criticized Tharoor's praise of PM Modi, implying a 'Modi first, country later' approach. This followed Tharoor's article highlighting Modi's global engagement as a prime asset for India.

title: Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union opens up about financial pressures
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, discussed her financial strategies at a recent event. She highlighted the need for multiple income streams. Union emphasized managing expenses, including supporting her extended family. She also mentioned dividing expenses with her husband, Dwyane Wade. The couple recently navigated Wade's health challenges. They continue to share updates about their lives with their fans.

title: Axiom-4 astronaut crew: Spacewalker, fighter pilot, skyjumper, & radiation specialist
content: As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, its rolling out reels and reels of tales. If the first post office or a telephone connection paints one colour, the Stamp of a stock market scam or the ‘Jewel Thieves’ scandal paint yet another colour. If failure of a sounding rocket was a stepping stone, sending 104 satellites in one go was a podium. If farmer suicides are a bad climax, growing number of Unicorns are a grand entry. Chethan Kumar, Senior Assistant Editor, The Times of India, who alternates between the mundane goings-on of the hoi polloi and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and Jawans, feels: There’s always a story, one just has to find it. Read More
